57 template<typename Socket>
58 class Session
59 {
60 public:
61  Session(boost::asio::io_service& io_service)
62  : socket_(io_service), client_version(PROTOCOL_UNKNOWN),
63  client_version_try(PROTOCOL_VER2),
64  timeout_interval_(boost::posix_time::milliseconds(5000)),
65  attempt_interval_(boost::posix_time::milliseconds(1000)),
66  require_check_interval_(boost::posix_time::milliseconds(1000)),
67  sync_timer_(io_service),
68  require_check_timer_(io_service),
69  async_read_buffer_(socket_, buffer_max,
70  boost::bind(&Session::read_failed, this,
71  boost::asio::placeholders::error))
72  {
73  callbacks_[rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_PUBLISHER]
74  = boost::bind(&Session::setup_publisher, this, _1);
75  callbacks_[rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_SUBSCRIBER]
76  = boost::bind(&Session::setup_subscriber, this, _1);
77  callbacks_[rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_SERVICE_CLIENT+rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_PUBLISHER]
78  = boost::bind(&Session::setup_service_client_publisher, this, _1);
79  callbacks_[rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_SERVICE_CLIENT+rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_SUBSCRIBER]
80  = boost::bind(&Session::setup_service_client_subscriber, this, _1);
81  callbacks_[rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_TIME]
82  = boost::bind(&Session::handle_time, this, _1);
83  }
84 
85  virtual ~Session()
86  {
87  ROS_INFO("Ending session.");
88  }

90  Socket& socket()
91  {
92  return socket_;
93  }

95  void start()
96  {
97  ROS_INFO("Starting session.");
98 
99  attempt_sync();
100  read_sync_header();
101  }

103  enum Version {
104  PROTOCOL_UNKNOWN = 0,
105  PROTOCOL_VER1 = 1,
106  PROTOCOL_VER2 = 2,
107  PROTOCOL_MAX
108  };
109 
110 private:
112  // TODO: Total message timeout, implement primarily in ReadBuffer.
113 
114  void read_sync_header() {
115  async_read_buffer_.read(1, boost::bind(&Session::read_sync_first, this, _1));
116  }
117 
118  void read_sync_first(ros::serialization::IStream& stream) {
119  uint8_t sync;
120  stream >> sync;
121  if (sync == 0xff) {
122  async_read_buffer_.read(1, boost::bind(&Session::read_sync_second, this, _1));
123  } else {
124  read_sync_header();
125  }
126  }
127 
128  void read_sync_second(ros::serialization::IStream& stream) {
129  uint8_t sync;
130  stream >> sync;
131  if (client_version == PROTOCOL_UNKNOWN) {
132  if (sync == 0xff) {
133  ROS_WARN("Attached client is using protocol VER1 (groovy)");
134  client_version = PROTOCOL_VER1;
135  } else if (sync == 0xfe) {
136  ROS_INFO("Attached client is using protocol VER2 (hydro)");
137  client_version = PROTOCOL_VER2;
138  }
139  }
140  if (sync == 0xff && client_version == PROTOCOL_VER1) {
141  async_read_buffer_.read(4, boost::bind(&Session::read_id_length, this, _1));
142  } else if (sync == 0xfe && client_version == PROTOCOL_VER2) {
143  async_read_buffer_.read(5, boost::bind(&Session::read_id_length, this, _1));
144  } else {
145  read_sync_header();
146  }
147  }
148 
149  void read_id_length(ros::serialization::IStream& stream) {
150  uint16_t topic_id, length;
151  uint8_t length_checksum;
152  if (client_version == PROTOCOL_VER2) {
153  // Complex header with checksum byte for length field.
154  stream >> length >> length_checksum;
155  if (length_checksum + checksum(length) != 0xff) {
156  uint8_t csl = checksum(length);
157  ROS_WARN("Bad message header length checksum. Dropping message from client. T%d L%d C%d %d", topic_id, length, length_checksum, csl);
158  read_sync_header();
159  return;
160  } else {
161  stream >> topic_id;
162  }
163  } else if (client_version == PROTOCOL_VER1) {
164  // Simple header in VER1 protocol.
165  stream >> topic_id >> length;
166  }
167  ROS_DEBUG("Received message header with length %d and topic_id=%d", length, topic_id);
168 
169  // Read message length + checksum byte.
170  async_read_buffer_.read(length + 1, boost::bind(&Session::read_body, this,
171  _1, topic_id));
172  }
173 
174  void read_body(ros::serialization::IStream& stream, uint16_t topic_id) {
175  ROS_DEBUG("Received body of length %d for message on topic %d.", stream.getLength(), topic_id);
176 
177  ros::serialization::IStream checksum_stream(stream.getData(), stream.getLength());
178 
179  uint8_t msg_checksum = checksum(checksum_stream) + checksum(topic_id);
180  if (client_version == PROTOCOL_VER1) {
181  msg_checksum += checksum(stream.getLength() - 1);
182  }
183 
184  if (msg_checksum != 0xff) {
185  ROS_WARN("Rejecting message on topicId=%d, length=%d with bad checksum.", topic_id, stream.getLength());
186  } else {
187  if (callbacks_.count(topic_id) == 1) {
188  try {
189  callbacks_[topic_id](stream);
190  } catch(ros::serialization::StreamOverrunException e) {
191  if (topic_id < 100) {
192  ROS_ERROR("Buffer overrun when attempting to parse setup message.");
193  ROS_ERROR_ONCE("Is this firmware from a pre-Groovy rosserial?");
194  } else {
195  ROS_WARN("Buffer overrun when attempting to parse user message.");
196  }
197  }
198  } else {
199  ROS_WARN("Received message with unrecognized topicId (%d).", topic_id);
200  // TODO: Resynchronize on multiples?
201  }
202  }
203 
204  // Kickoff next message read.
205  read_sync_header();
206  }
207 
208  void read_failed(const boost::system::error_code& error) {
209  if (error == boost::system::errc::no_buffer_space) {
210  // No worries. Begin syncing on a new message.
211  ROS_WARN("Overrun on receive buffer. Attempting to regain rx sync.");
212  read_sync_header();
213  } else if (error) {
214  // When some other read error has occurred, delete the whole session, which destroys
215  // all publishers and subscribers.
216  socket_.cancel();
217  ROS_DEBUG_STREAM("Socket asio error: " << error);
218  ROS_WARN("Stopping session due to read error.");
219  delete this;
220  }
221  }
222 
224 
225  void write_message(Buffer& message,
226  const uint16_t topic_id,
227  Session::Version version) {
228  uint8_t overhead_bytes = 0;
229  switch(version) {
230  case PROTOCOL_VER2: overhead_bytes = 8; break;
231  case PROTOCOL_VER1: overhead_bytes = 7; break;
232  default:
233  ROS_WARN("Aborting write_message: protocol unspecified.");
234  }
235 
236  uint16_t length = overhead_bytes + message.size();
237  BufferPtr buffer_ptr(new Buffer(length));
238 
239  uint8_t msg_checksum;
240  ros::serialization::IStream checksum_stream(message.size() > 0 ? &message[0] : NULL, message.size());
241 
242  ros::serialization::OStream stream(&buffer_ptr->at(0), buffer_ptr->size());
243  if (version == PROTOCOL_VER2) {
244  uint8_t msg_len_checksum = 255 - checksum(message.size());
245  stream << (uint16_t)0xfeff << (uint16_t)message.size() << msg_len_checksum << topic_id;
246  msg_checksum = 255 - (checksum(checksum_stream) + checksum(topic_id));
247  } else if (version == PROTOCOL_VER1) {
248  stream << (uint16_t)0xffff << topic_id << (uint16_t)message.size();
249  msg_checksum = 255 - (checksum(checksum_stream) + checksum(topic_id) + checksum(message.size()));
250  }
251  memcpy(stream.advance(message.size()), &message[0], message.size());
252  stream << msg_checksum;
253 
254  // Will call immediately if we are already on the io_service thread. Otherwise,
255  // the request is queued up and executed on that thread.
256  socket_.get_io_service().dispatch(
257  boost::bind(&Session::write_buffer, this, buffer_ptr));
258  }
259 
260  // Function which is dispatched onto the io_service thread by write_message, so that
261  // write_message may be safely called directly from the ROS background spinning thread.
262  void write_buffer(BufferPtr buffer_ptr) {
263  boost::asio::async_write(socket_, boost::asio::buffer(*buffer_ptr),
264  boost::bind(&Session::write_cb, this, boost::asio::placeholders::error, buffer_ptr));
265  }
266 
267  void write_cb(const boost::system::error_code& error,
268  BufferPtr buffer_ptr) {
269  if (error) {
270  if (error == boost::system::errc::io_error) {
271  ROS_WARN_THROTTLE(1, "Socket write operation returned IO error.");
272  } else if (error == boost::system::errc::no_such_device) {
273  ROS_WARN_THROTTLE(1, "Socket write operation returned no device.");
274  } else {
275  socket_.cancel();
276  ROS_WARN_STREAM_THROTTLE(1, "Unknown error returned during write operation: " << error);
277  ROS_WARN("Destroying session.");
278  delete this;
279  }
280  }
281  // Buffer is destructed when this function exits.
282  }
283 
285  void attempt_sync() {
286  request_topics();
287  set_sync_timeout(attempt_interval_);
288  }
289 
290  void set_sync_timeout(const boost::posix_time::time_duration& interval) {
291  sync_timer_.cancel();
292  sync_timer_.expires_from_now(interval);
293  sync_timer_.async_wait(boost::bind(&Session::sync_timeout, this,
294  boost::asio::placeholders::error));
295  }
296 
297  void sync_timeout(const boost::system::error_code& error) {
298  if (error == boost::asio::error::operation_aborted) {
299  return;
300  }
301  ROS_WARN("Sync with device lost.");
302  attempt_sync();
303  }
304 
306  void request_topics() {
307  // Once this session has previously connected using a given protocol version,
308  // always attempt that one. If not, though, cycle between available options.
309  if (client_version != PROTOCOL_UNKNOWN) client_version_try = client_version;
310 
311  std::vector<uint8_t> message(0);
312  if (client_version_try == PROTOCOL_VER2) {
313  ROS_DEBUG("Sending request topics message for VER2 protocol.");
314  write_message(message, rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_PUBLISHER, PROTOCOL_VER2);
315  client_version_try = PROTOCOL_VER1;
316  } else if (client_version_try == PROTOCOL_VER1) {
317  ROS_DEBUG("Sending request topics message for VER1 protocol.");
318  write_message(message, rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_PUBLISHER, PROTOCOL_VER1);
319  client_version_try = PROTOCOL_VER2;
320  } else {
321  client_version_try = PROTOCOL_VER2;
322  }
323 
324  // Set timer for future point at which to verify the subscribers and publishers
325  // created by the client against the expected set given in the parameters.
326  require_check_timer_.expires_from_now(require_check_interval_);
327  require_check_timer_.async_wait(boost::bind(&Session::required_topics_check, this,
328  boost::asio::placeholders::error));
329  }
330 
331  void required_topics_check(const boost::system::error_code& error) {
332  if (ros::param::has("~require")) {
333  if (!check_set("~require/publishers", publishers_) ||
334  !check_set("~require/subscribers", subscribers_)) {
335  ROS_WARN("Connected client failed to establish the publishers and subscribers dictated by require parameter. Re-requesting topics.");
336  request_topics();
337  }
338  }
339  }
340 
341  template<typename M>
342  bool check_set(std::string param_name, M map) {
343  XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue param_list;
344  ros::param::get(param_name, param_list);
345  ROS_ASSERT(param_list.getType() == XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue::TypeArray);
346  for (int i = 0; i < param_list.size(); ++i) {
347  ROS_ASSERT(param_list[i].getType() == XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue::TypeString);
348  std::string required_topic((std::string(param_list[i])));
349  // Iterate through map of registered topics, to ensure that this one is present.
350  bool found = false;
351  for (typename M::iterator j = map.begin(); j != map.end(); ++j) {
352  if (nh_.resolveName(j->second->get_topic()) ==
353  nh_.resolveName(required_topic)) {
354  found = true;
355  break;
356  }
357  }
358  if (!found) return false;
359  }
360  return true;
361  }
362 
363  static uint8_t checksum(ros::serialization::IStream& stream) {
364  uint8_t sum = 0;
365  for (uint16_t i = 0; i < stream.getLength(); ++i) {
366  sum += stream.getData()[i];
367  }
368  return sum;
369  }
370 
371  static uint8_t checksum(uint16_t val) {
372  return (val >> 8) + val;
373  }
374 
376 
377  void setup_publisher(ros::serialization::IStream& stream) {
378  rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo topic_info;
379  ros::serialization::Serializer<rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo>::read(stream, topic_info);
380 
381  PublisherPtr pub(new Publisher(nh_, topic_info));
382  publishers_[topic_info.topic_id] = pub;
383  callbacks_[topic_info.topic_id] = boost::bind(&Publisher::handle, pub, _1);
384 
385  set_sync_timeout(timeout_interval_);
386  }
387 
388  void setup_subscriber(ros::serialization::IStream& stream) {
389  rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo topic_info;
390  ros::serialization::Serializer<rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo>::read(stream, topic_info);
391 
392  SubscriberPtr sub(new Subscriber(nh_, topic_info,
393  boost::bind(&Session::write_message, this, _1, topic_info.topic_id, client_version)));
394  subscribers_[topic_info.topic_id] = sub;
395 
396  set_sync_timeout(timeout_interval_);
397  }
398 
399  // When the rosserial client creates a ServiceClient object (and/or when it registers that object with the NodeHandle)
400  // it creates a publisher (to publish the service request message to us) and a subscriber (to receive the response)
401  // the service client callback is attached to the *subscriber*, so when we receive the service response
402  // and wish to send it over the socket to the client,
403  // we must attach the topicId that came from the service client subscriber message
404 
405  void setup_service_client_publisher(ros::serialization::IStream& stream) {
406  rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo topic_info;
407  ros::serialization::Serializer<rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo>::read(stream, topic_info);
408 
409  if (!services_.count(topic_info.topic_name)) {
410  ROS_DEBUG("Creating service client for topic %s",topic_info.topic_name.c_str());
411  ServiceClientPtr srv(new ServiceClient(
412  nh_,topic_info,boost::bind(&Session::write_message, this, _1, _2, client_version)));
413  services_[topic_info.topic_name] = srv;
414  callbacks_[topic_info.topic_id] = boost::bind(&ServiceClient::handle, srv, _1);
415  }
416  if (services_[topic_info.topic_name]->getRequestMessageMD5() != topic_info.md5sum) {
417  ROS_WARN("Service client setup: Request message MD5 mismatch between rosserial client and ROS");
418  } else {
419  ROS_DEBUG("Service client %s: request message MD5 successfully validated as %s",
420  topic_info.topic_name.c_str(),topic_info.md5sum.c_str());
421  }
422  set_sync_timeout(timeout_interval_);
423  }
424 
425  void setup_service_client_subscriber(ros::serialization::IStream& stream) {
426  rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo topic_info;
427  ros::serialization::Serializer<rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo>::read(stream, topic_info);
428 
429  if (!services_.count(topic_info.topic_name)) {
430  ROS_DEBUG("Creating service client for topic %s",topic_info.topic_name.c_str());
431  ServiceClientPtr srv(new ServiceClient(
432  nh_,topic_info,boost::bind(&Session::write_message, this, _1, _2, client_version)));
433  services_[topic_info.topic_name] = srv;
434  callbacks_[topic_info.topic_id] = boost::bind(&ServiceClient::handle, srv, _1);
435  }
436  // see above comment regarding the service client callback for why we set topic_id here
437  services_[topic_info.topic_name]->setTopicId(topic_info.topic_id);
438  if (services_[topic_info.topic_name]->getResponseMessageMD5() != topic_info.md5sum) {
439  ROS_WARN("Service client setup: Response message MD5 mismatch between rosserial client and ROS");
440  } else {
441  ROS_DEBUG("Service client %s: response message MD5 successfully validated as %s",
442  topic_info.topic_name.c_str(),topic_info.md5sum.c_str());
443  }
444  set_sync_timeout(timeout_interval_);
445  }
446 
447  void handle_time(ros::serialization::IStream& stream) {
448  std_msgs::Time time;
449  time.data = ros::Time::now();
450 
451  size_t length = ros::serialization::serializationLength(time);
452  std::vector<uint8_t> message(length);
453 
454  ros::serialization::OStream ostream(&message[0], length);
455  ros::serialization::Serializer<std_msgs::Time>::write(ostream, time);
456 
457  write_message(message, rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_TIME, client_version);
458 
459  // The MCU requesting the time from the server is the sync notification. This
460  // call moves the timeout forward.
461  set_sync_timeout(timeout_interval_);
462  }
463 
464  Socket socket_;
465  AsyncReadBuffer<Socket> async_read_buffer_;
466  enum { buffer_max = 1023 };
467  ros::NodeHandle nh_;
468 
469  Session::Version client_version;
470  Session::Version client_version_try;
471  boost::posix_time::time_duration timeout_interval_;
472  boost::posix_time::time_duration attempt_interval_;
473  boost::posix_time::time_duration require_check_interval_;
474  boost::asio::deadline_timer sync_timer_;
475  boost::asio::deadline_timer require_check_timer_;
476 
477  std::map< uint16_t, boost::function<void(ros::serialization::IStream)> > callbacks_;
478  std::map<uint16_t, PublisherPtr> publishers_;
479  std::map<uint16_t, SubscriberPtr> subscribers_;
480  std::map<std::string, ServiceClientPtr> services_;
481 };
